Posts.EditableText:
Save the original attributes of an object prior to making changes when an option is made under a tab. When a selection is made, the library will add attributes to the object, but if you mistakenly made the wrong selection and go back to "none" the attributes remain. This can be changed manually but for some novices (like me) it can get confusing.

Since Quest is about ease of creation it may be worth considering, plus I don't have to make the code changes so it's easy to suggest. (Ar Ar)
Posts.HTML:

When a selection is made, the library will add attributes to the object, but if you mistakenly made the wrong selection and go back to "none" the attributes remain. This can be changed manually but for some novices (like me) it can get confusing.

Since Quest is about ease of creation it may be worth considering, plus I don't have to make the code changes so it's easy to suggest. (Ar Ar)

Posts.EditableText: If you go to the _Attributes_ tab, you can delete any attribute of an object. If that object has a default setting from a library, it will revert to that.
Posts.HTML: If you go to the Attributes tab, you can delete any attribute of an object. If that object has a default setting from a library, it will revert to that.

Posts.EditableText:
You can always start over and add/download the library again. I know it's not fun or ideal, but it's a last ditch effort.

Also, hi everyone. I know I haven't been around much, I have been working. I'm just busy and don't have as much free time as I'd like.
